page.title: 06RELIGION
page.content: Godolphin has an Anglican Church, St. John the Baptist, which dates from the mid_19th century and a Methodist Chapel built in 1934. Carleen has a Church of the Apostolic Evangelical Pentecostal faith built in the 20th century and a Methodist Chapel dating from 1833. There is also an Anglican Church at Sithney and a Methodist Chapel at Nancegollan just outside our area but attended by people from within the area. The Churches are attended by a number of regular worshippers and provide a valuable focus for active Christians within the community.
